alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:04PM CDT until May 08 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Walnut River at Winfield affecting Butler and Cowley Counties. For the Walnut River...including El Dorado, Augusta, Winfield, Arkansas City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut River at Winfield. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, A large portion of the fairgrounds flood along with rural roads about 3 miles northwest of Winfield that are near the river. Then one mile west of the city of Rock, expect 30th Road to be closed due to high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:31 PM CDT Friday the stage was 23.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Walnut River Winfield 18.0 23.3 Fri 7 pm CDT 22.7 13.1 8.1 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
